title: Minuteman Missile National Historic Site: Camping
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Eating & Sleeping     Camping              Campgrounds       Minuteman Missile National Historic Site does not have camping facilities, but nearby Badlands National Park has both developed and primitive campgrounds. In addition, the Buffalo Gap National Grasslands managed by the U.S. Forest Service, which surrounds much of Minuteman Missile, also allows camping. To learn more read the information below.        Cedar Pass Campground at Badlands National Park has plenty sites within view of the Badlands formations Roberta M. Gorman - NPS Photo   Badlands National Park Camping  The Badlands National Park main entrance is located four miles south of the Minuteman Missile Visitor Center.              Dispersed camping is allowed on the Buffalo Gap National Grasslands U.S. Forest Service  Buffalo Gap National Grasslands Camping The Wall Ranger District of the Buffalo Gap National Grasslands surrounds all three sites at Minuteman Missile. The National Grasslands are managed by the U.S. Forest Service. Dispersed camping is allowed. For more information about camping on the grasslands click here.  For other questions visit the National Grasslands Visitor Center, located in the town of Wall, 21 miles east of the Minuteman Missile Visitor Center.
